revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Comtrend |model=NexusLink 3111u |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=07/01/2013 |manuf_country= |manuf= |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=wireless router, dsl modem |fcc_id=L9VNL-3111U |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM63168U |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1= |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model= |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1= |ram1_brand= |ram1_model= |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM63168U |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand= |eth_chip2_model= |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu=true |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports= |flags=VDSL, bonded DSL |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=root |default_pass=12345 |oui= |oui_eth= }} ''Multi-DSL Bonded Router''
[http://www.comtrend.com/links/178$product.htm Product page] :[http://www.comtrend.com/dbase/upload/DS_NexusLink3111u.pdf Datasheet] "50XX13-021", a lead-free symbol, and "C074E143A0" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. :The DSL/WiSoC is a BCM63168UKFEBG. The FCC test report indicates that this FCC covers both the NexusLink-3111u and the NexusLink-3110u. :It is stated the different models are for market segmentation. The datasheet indicates that the device supports VDSL2 and has one GbE ''Flex'' port (the rest are 10/100). Per the FCC manual... *There are three privileged accounts. **root:12345 for administrative access **user:user for user access **support:support for remote (WAN) access *The sample SSID is shown as '''Comtrend'''.
